solution_line_template: Josephine filled a total of {liters_per_container_1} x {num_containers_1} = <<{liters_per_container_1}*{num_containers_1}={total_liters_container_1}>>{total_liters_container_1} liters from the three containers with two liters each.

She filled a total of {liters_per_container_2} x {num_containers_2} = <<{liters_per_container_2}*{num_containers_2}={total_liters_container_2}>>{total_liters_container_2} liters from the two containers with {liters_per_container_2} liters each.

She filled a total of {liters_per_container_3} x {num_containers_3} = <<{liters_per_container_3}*{num_containers_3}={total_liters_container_3}>>{total_liters_container_3} liters from the five containers with {liters_per_container_3} liters each.

Therefore, she sold a total of {total_liters_container_1} + {total_liters_container_2} + {total_liters_container_3} = <<{total_liters_container_1}+{total_liters_container_2}+{total_liters_container_3}={total_milk_sold}>>{total_milk_sold} liters of milk.
